column2: SC DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: South Carolina
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column4: fix
column6: replace

column2: 2. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.
column6: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.
column8: it draws the attention of other drivers.

column2: 3. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Low ground clearance railroad crossing
column6: Parallel railroad crossing (crossroad)

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column6: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 5. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column6: The driver on the left.
column8: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 6. _________________ your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes.
column4: Always rely on
column6: Never use

column2: 7. Which statement about yielding right-of-way is true?
column4: Drivers turning right at intersections have the right-of-way over pedestrians crossing the intersection.
column6: When turning left at an intersection, you may turn left before the oncoming traffic.
column8: Although there are laws governing right of way, drivers should never “demand” their right-of-way.

column2: 8. This road sign is:
column4: a regulatory sign.
column6: a speed reduction sign.

column2: 9. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Apply the parking brake slowly.

column2: 10. Hydroplaning is when:
column4: your tires start to ride up on the water and lose all contact with the road.
column6: splash and spray from large trucks reduces visibility.
column8: heavy rain forces you to move to the right side of the road and stop.

column2: 11. When driving on a road with two or more lanes traveling in the same direction, you should:
column4: drive in the left lane.
column6: drive in the right lane.

column2: 12. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 13. Which of these statements about steering is true?
column4: Both hands should be placed on the outside of the steering wheel.
column6: The steering wheel is always turned in the direction you want the vehicle to move, whether moving forward or in reverse.

column2: 14. Drivers operating a vehicle on South Carolina roadways have already agreed to submit a chemical test or tests when requested by a law enforcement officer.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 15. If you are involved in a traffic collision, you should:
column4: report the accident within 24 hours.
column6: move your vehicle from the roadway to the shoulder, aid the injured, protect the scene and notify the authorities.
column8: report the accident to your insurance company immediately, then notify the authorities.

column2: 16. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: make a U-turn.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column8: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 17. Which of these statements about speed management is true?
column4: As your speed increases, the chance of being involved in a fatal crash increases.
column6: As your speed increases, so should your following distance.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Parking is not allowed.
column6: U-turns are not allowed.

column2: 19. A crosswalk is:
column4: a special type of 4-way intersection.
column6: an area designated for blind persons.
column8: the area where pedestrians may cross the road.

column2: 20. Before you enter and start a parked vehicle, you should:
column4: Start the engine, adjust the side mirror and check the fuel gauge.
column6: Check the gear shift and the defroster.
column8: Walk around and check your vehicle, when inside adjust the seat, mirrors and fasten the safety belt.

column2: 21. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: stop if necessary.
column6: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 22. Which statement about driving too slowly is true?
column4: You should drive with the flow of traffic as long as the traffic is not exceeding the posted speed limit.
column6: Driving too slowly is not an unsafe driving practice.
column8: The speed at which you drive does not affect your safety.

column2: 23. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: closetailing.
column6: speedgating.

column2: 24. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 25. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column6: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.
column8: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.

column2: 26. Motorcycles:
column4: are easier to see than cars.
column6: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.

column2: 27. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 28. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 29. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way
column6: Traffic signal ahead
